justification: The article notes that "ST has successfully explained the developmental trajectory of ToM reasoning, from early success in false-belief tests, to later understanding of more complex ToM tasks," explicitly linking Theory of Mind reasoning to performance on false-belief tests.

When illustrating how mental-state understanding is assessed, the authors reference "the ice cream task from Perner and Wimmer (1985)" as the example used to track children’s reasoning about others’ beliefs, i.e., their Theory of Mind.
